newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - March 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - March 7.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - National Assembly member nabbed in gangster crackdown.
Central bank governor Sheu Yuan-dong vows to maintain stable-to-loose monetary policy.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - Canada to release six Taiwan sailors in stowaway case.
Cooperative unions are among 11 industries to be incorporated into Labour Law in 1998.
LIBERTY TIMES - Central banker Sheu says central bank a bit concerned about stock market fever.
Taipei mayor Chen Shui-bian rejects "reunification overture" from visiting Beijing cultural group.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Central bank says will keep monetary policy stable-to-loose, but not too loose.
Formosa group chairman Wang Yung-ching says will not build China power plant without government approval.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Privatisation for "big three" state-run commercial banks to be completed by 1998 at earliest.
Sheu Yuan-dong says foreign exchange rate at "reasonable" level.
